pullRequest.title: Don't open the HTTP socket until late in the startup process
pullRequest.bodyText:
This makes sure that we don't open the HTTP socket until
all start events have been run and all ServiceStartBuildItem
events have been run.
This also makes sure that the runtime bean map has been initialized
by this point.
Fixes #8269

nodes.bodyText: @stuartwdouglas I'm not sure a concurrent map is needed since we still synchronize on it, the sync block is needed to avoid the concurrent connection requests. But I suppose it is performing better anyway, the concurrent map.
Interesting, so this is how one can register the application scoped like singletons at runtime
@stuartwdouglas I need it to be a Singleton. Many clients are casting it to VertxInternal (I know it's bad). With ApplciaitonScoped it does not work anymore.
